greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Leftmost 1 is converted to a 2, which then propagates one step at a time until it is rightmost; then it changes to a pair of 1's and the process repeats.
comment: Arises in analysis of Bulgarian solitaire.
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
mathematica: f1[{a_,b_}]:={a,NestList[FromDigits[RotateRight[IntegerDigits[#]]]&, b, IntegerLength[ b]-1]}; Join[{0},f1/@Table[{FromDigits[PadRight[{},n,1]], FromDigits[ PadRight[{2},n,1]]},{n,7}]//Flatten] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, May 15 2018 *)
results.author: _Allan C. Wechsler_, Jun 07 2002
